author: Staff Reporter
text:
Almost all the shops in Ambur and Vaniyambadi towns remained closed on Saturday. This is in response to the bandh call given by BJP to condemn the attack on its state council member Sivaprakasam by unidentified persons in Vaniyambadi on Friday.

Mr. Sivaprakasam was brutally attacked when he was returning from a temple in new town area of Vaniyambadi. He was immediately hospitalised. BJP leader H.Raja visited him on Friday itself and demanded immediate police action to fix culprits.

Meanwhile BJP has given a call to people of Vaniyambadi and Ambur to close the shutters of the shops on Saturday to condemn the attack on Mr.Sivaprakasam.

Police forces were posted to prevent untoward incidents and preventive arrests were made. As many as 85 cadres from BJP, Hindu Munnani and Hindu Makkal Katchi were arrested on Saturday morning and released in the evening.

However, most of the shops remained closed in these towns all through the day though transport remained unaffected. Shops were opened after 6 in the evening.
title: Bandh in Ambur, Vaniyambadi
